page.title: 13WANSFORD'S POLICEMAN
page.content: The village policeman is a member of the Cambridgeshire Constabulary which is split into two divisions: the north division has its headquarters in Peterborough and the Wansford area is in a sub-division of this area. The policeman's home in Wittering doubles as his police station. The area which is policed by ten officers covers 65,000 acres and although the ten policemen are responsible for traffic in their area there are Traffic Department patrols too. The most common crime in the Wansford area is burglary. An important part of the policeman's work, though is crime prevention, and he does this by talking to groups of people in schools, parish councils and other organizations.
